channel.title: RNZ New Zealand Headlines
channel.description: The Latest New Zealand headlines from RNZ News

item.title: Police admit to failings in arrest of young Māori boy
item.description: Police have apologised to the whānau of a 16-year-old boy from Masterton who was arrested last year after being mistaken for a suspect.

item.title: Nearly all of Jucy rentals stolen during lockdown recovered
item.description: Almost all of the Jucy rental vehicles stolen from a car yard in South Auckland during the level 4 lockdown have been tracked down.

item.title: Christchurch's historic Isaac Theatre Royal restarts operations
item.description: Christchurch's historic Isaac Theatre Royal is gradually restarting operations after being shut due to the Covid-19 lockdown.

item.title: Covid Tracing app Bluetooth tech unreliable - NZDF
item.description: The Defence Force has told the government that Bluetooth contact tracing technology may result in "false contacts" or fail to record contact.

item.title: Police ending Armed Response Teams after trial - Commissioner
item.description: Police Commissioner Andrew Coster has today announced that Armed Response Teams will not be part of the New Zealand policing model in the future.

item.title: Minister warns immigrants labour market gaps may close
item.description: The government is looking at how up to 10,000 immigrants can return to New Zealand, Minister Iain Lees-Galloway says, but they may need to reconsider their employment.

item.title: Te Anau murder accused revealed as victim's husband
item.description: The man accused of murdering Balclutha woman Shirley Reedy in Te Anau last month can now be revealed as her husband, Rodney Fallowfield.

item.title: Wellington Airport expansion plans delayed
item.description: A massive drop in passenger numbers has forced Wellington Airport to delay plans for a billion-dollar-plus expansion and upgrade.

item.title: Police name man who died in Hamilton homicide inquiry
item.description: Police have named the man whose death in Hamilton last week sparked a homicide inquiry.

item.title: Far North council rates to increase 2.23%
item.description: After deliberating on submissions to its annual plan, FNDC has voted on a rates rise of 2.23 percent, down from the 3.94 percent rise plannned before the economic downturn.

item.title: No new cases of Covid-19 for 18th day, but stricter border measures in place - Bloomfield
item.description: From today people in managed isolation will not be allowed to apply for exemptions to attend funerals and tangihanga.

item.title: Teachers vote no confidence in Teaching Council over fee increase
item.description: Anger at a jump in registration fees has prompted secondary teachers to vote no confidence in their own professional body, the Teaching Council.

item.title: Record number of Aucklanders have their say on Emergency Budget
item.description: A record number of Aucklanders are having their say on the council's Emergency Budget 2020/2021.

item.title: Live Covid-19 updates from New Zealand and around the world on 9 June
item.description: The World Health Organisation has recorded the biggest global daily increase of Covid-19 cases. Follow our blog for live updates.

item.title: Police seek help in finding missing Waikato teen
item.description: Waikato Police are asking for the public's help to find missing Hamilton teenager Freedom Davis.

item.title: Manual contact tracing systems are 'completely unacceptable' - epidemiologist
item.description: New Zealand's contact tracing system is far from state of the art and still needs a lot of improvement, says an epidemiologist.

item.title: Police search for convicted killer in Canterbury
item.description: Melissa Wepa has a warrant for her arrest.

item.title: Weather: Freezing conditions on the way for weekend
item.description: The South Island can expect temperatures as low as -15 this weekend.
